message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyze the impact of Climate Smart Agriculture interventions in Africa using household survey data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Our study combines two rich datasets: the nationally representative household-level Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS) from 2016-17, and an administrative dataset from the Ghana Education Service (GES).", "dataset": ["Ghana Living Standards Survey (GLSS)", "administrative dataset from the Ghana Education Service (GES)"], "topic": ["Education"]}, {"sentence": "Using a unique dataset of labor market history and biometric data for migrants and non-migrants in Cambodia, we estimate that migration lowers overall mortality rates among adult men by approximately 40% relative to their non-migrating peers.", "dataset": ["unique dataset of labor market history and biometric data for migrants and non-migrants in Cambodia"], "topic": ["Migration", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "We also use a dataset of country readiness for digital transformation the Networked Readiness Index compiled by the World Economic Forum to unveil factors inhibiting digital development.", "dataset": ["Networked Readiness Index"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis uses high-resolution rainfall data from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and Conflict and Health dataset assembled by the Armed Conflict Location and Event Data Project (ACLED).", "dataset": ["National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)", "Conflict and Health dataset assembled by the Armed Conflict Location and Event Data Project (ACLED)"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management ", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We analyzed data from multiple sources such as the Demographic and Health Survey, the National Survey on Drug Use and Health, the Global School-based Student Health Survey and other data to assess gender differences in tobacco use across different countries.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Survey", "National Survey on Drug Use and Health", "Global School-based Student Health Survey"], "topic": ["Gender", "Health"]}, {"sentence": "Our paper relies primarily on data from individual consumption expenditure surveys, mainly the Nigeria Living Standards Survey-Panel (LSMS-P) and the Harmonized Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HHIES).", "dataset": ["Nigeria Living Standards Survey-Panel (LSMS-P)", "Harmonized Household Income and Expenditure Survey (HHIES)"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "Using a longitudinal dataset of labor markets from career transitions and employer job advertisements posted on professional social media platform LinkedIn, we analyze gender segregation across occupations.", "dataset": ["longitudinal dataset of labor markets from career transitions and employer job advertisements posted on professional social media platform LinkedIn"], "topic": ["Gender", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We rely on cross-country datasets like the State-Owned Enterprises Database by the IMF, Enterprise Surveys by the World Bank Group, and Dealogic that provides data on investment deals worldwide to examine the effects of state ownership on firms' capital raising opportunities.", "dataset": ["State-Owned Enterprises Database by the IMF", "Enterprise Surveys by the World Bank Group", "Dealogic"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "Using geospatial data, specifically Landsat 8 imagery and Open Street Maps (OSM), we estimate the impacts of urban unplanned settlements on water access for different population groups", "dataset": ["Landsat 8 imagery", "Open Street Maps (OSM)"], "topic": ["Water", "Urban Development"]}]
